Hi All,

With regard to the flushing it should be OK, the code I posted has
calls to network.ClearSignals() which resets the network state. I did
however accidentally cut off the top test case when I cut and pasted
the code, and that case isn't preceded by ClearSignals() because I
happen to know that the network has just been constructed and is
already reset - it's a misleading optimisation though that can lead to
errors and/or confusion when experimenting with the code.

So hopefully that network I posted should work as a test case for
Rob's neural net code. It will of course require two activations.

Colin.
